Scenario S1 goal: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_8

Scenario S1 user plan: clip object_12 object_4 object_10; wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_12 object_4 object_8; wretched object_3 object_7 object_6 object_1; clip object_11 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_7 object_1; tightfisted object_11 object_3 object_7
analyst_alpha.goal: Verify and normalize Scenario S1 objects, predicates, and goals; map them to the shared action schemas; produce a clean, grounded fact list and goal set for problem S1; assess whether the provided plan is consistent with preconditions and effects.

private_information: Scenario S2 initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_9, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_7, next object_4 object_8, next object_5 object_11, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9
Scenario S2 goal: next object_12 object_10 and next object_13 object_9
analyst_beta.goal: Normalize Scenario S2 objects, predicates, and goals; map them to the shared action schemas; produce a clean, grounded fact list and goal set for problem S2; identify any constraints or helpful action orderings.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate normalized contexts from analyst_alpha and analyst_beta and produce a single PDDL domain plus two PDDL problem instances (S1 and S2) suitable for the FastDownward solver.

public_information: Domain Depots23 uses objects named object_0, object_1, ..., object_13; all objects share the same type obj.
Predicates: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), texture(x), stupendous(x); binary predicates: next(x,y), vase(x,y), collect(x,y).
Action paltry(o0,o1,o2) requires: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2; effects: add next o0 o2; delete vase o0 o1.
Action sip(o0,o1,o2) requires: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2; effects: add vase o0 o1; delete next o0 o2.
Action clip(o0,o1,o2) requires: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2; effects: add vase o0 o1; delete next o0 o2.
Action wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3) requires: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3; effects: add next o0 o2; delete next o0 o1.
Action memory(o0,o1,o2) requires: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1; effects: add next o0 o2; delete next o0 o1.
Action tightfisted(o0,o1,o2) requires: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1; effects: add next o0 o2; delete vase o0 o1.
There are two planning scenarios: S1 with a user-proposed plan and S2 without a plan; both must be expressible with the shared domain.

context.system_prompt: You are a planning analyst. Do not produce PDDL. Extract and normalize the Scenario S1 objects, facts, and goals from your knowledge into a compact JSON summary with keys: objects (unique set), init (list of grounded predicates), goal (list of grounded predicates), candidate_plan (if given, in order). Validate the candidate plan against public action schemas and note any precondition mismatches. Keep notation exactly as in public_information (lowercase predicate names and object_* identifiers).
context.prompt: Your name is analyst_alpha. Use the public information about the shared actions and predicates and your private Scenario S1 data to produce a clean JSON summary suitable for conversion to PDDL by the orchestrator. Do not emit PDDL; focus on correctness and completeness of grounded facts and goals.

context.system_prompt: You are a planning analyst. Do not produce PDDL. Extract and normalize the Scenario S2 objects, facts, and goals from your knowledge into a compact JSON summary with keys: objects (unique set), init (list of grounded predicates), goal (list of grounded predicates), suggestions (optional ordering hints). Keep notation exactly as in public_information (lowercase predicate names and object_* identifiers).
context.prompt: Your name is analyst_beta. Use the public information about the shared actions and predicates and your private Scenario S2 data to produce a clean JSON summary suitable for conversion to PDDL by the orchestrator. Do not emit PDDL; focus on correctness and completeness of grounded facts and goals.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert planner. Integrate the normalized contexts to produce a single PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (S1 and S2) targeting the FastDownward solver. Use domain name depots23. Define a single type obj for all objects. Predicates: hand ?x - obj, cats ?x - obj, sneeze ?x - obj, spring ?x - obj, texture ?x - obj, stupendous ?x - obj, next ?x ?y - obj, vase ?x ?y - obj, collect ?x ?y - obj. Actions must exactly match the public preconditions and effects for paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted. Provide one <domain>...</domain> block and two <problem>...</problem> blocks: problem depots23-s1 with objects set covering all mentioned object_* in S1 and problem depots23-s2 with objects set covering all mentioned object_* in S2. For each problem, include the complete :init and :goal consistent with the contexts. Ensure syntax compatible with FastDownward (PDDL 3.1 is not required; use :requirements :strips :typing).
pddl.prompt: Produce a single PDDL domain and two problem instances from the analysts' contexts. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and each problem between <problem name="depots23-s1"></problem> and <problem name="depots23-s2"></problem> tags, respectively. Keep predicate and action names lowercase and consistent with the public information.
